name: nashidVerifySDK
description: The iOS SDK of Nashid Verify KYC tool

license.text:
Copyright (c) 2024  Nashid Enterprises LL

    This License Agreement ("Agreement") governs the use of the Nashid Verify 
    SDK ("Software"), developed by Nashid Enterprises LLC ("Licensor"). The 
    Software includes all associated updates, modifications, and documentation 
    provided by the Licensor.
    This Agreement outlines the terms under which any individual or entity 
    ("Licensee") may use, integrate, and distribute the Software. The Software is 
    designed to enable identity verification services and is intended for 
    integration into the Licensee's own applications, subject to the restrictions 
    and obligations outlined herein.

    1 Interpretations

      1.1 Definitions
      In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires:
        - "Agreement" refers to this Nashid Verify SDK License Agreement.
        - "Licensor" refers to Nashid Enterprises LLC, the entity providing the 
        Software under this Agreement.
        - "Licensee" refers to any individual or entity that downloads, uses, or 
        integrates the Software under the terms of this Agreement.
        - "Software" refers to the Nashid Verify SDK, including any updates, 
        modifications, and related documentation provided by the Licensor.
        - "Services" refers to the identity verification services provided by the 
        Software as part of its functionality.
        - "Confidential Information" refers to any non-public, proprietary 
        information disclosed by the Licensor to the Licensee during the term 
        of this Agreement.
        - "Intellectual Property Rights" refers to all rights, titles, and interests in 
        and to the Software, including but not limited to patents, trademarks, 
        copyrights, trade secrets, and other proprietary rights.
        - "Term" refers to the duration of this Agreement as defined in the Term 
        and Termination section.
        - "Territory" refers to the geographic area in which the Licensee is 
        permitted to use the Software as specified by the Licensor.

      1.2 Interpretation Rules
        - Words denoting the singular include the plural and vice versa.
        - References to any statute, regulation, or other law include all 
        amendments, re-enactments, and modifications thereto.
        - Section headings are inserted for convenience only and do not affect 
        the interpretation of this Agreement.
        - The terms "including," "include," or "in particular" shall be construed as
        illustrative and not limiting the scope of the preceding words.

    2 License Grant and Use

      2.1 License Grant
      Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Nashid Enterprises 
      LLC ("Licensor") hereby grants the Licensee a non-exclusive, non-
      transferable right and license, without the right to grant sublicenses, to use 
      the Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") and any accompanying documentation 
      during the term of this Agreement, solely for the Licensee's internal business
      operations.

      2.2 Prohibited Uses
      The Licensee shall not access, store, distribute, or transmit any material 
      using the Software that:
        (a) Is unlawful, harmful, threatening, defamatory, obscene, infringing, 
        harassing, or racially or ethnically offensive;
        (b) Facilitates illegal activity;
        (c) Promotes unlawful violence;
        (d) Is discriminatory based on race, gender, color, religious belief, sexual 
        orientation, disability; or
        (e) Is otherwise illegal or causes damage or injury to any person or 
        property.
      The Licensor reserves the right to disable the Licensee's access to any 
      material that breaches these provisions.

      2.3 License Restrictions
      The Licensee shall not:
        (a) Copy, modify, duplicate, create derivative works from, frame, mirror, 
        republish, download, display, transmit, or distribute any portion of the 
        Software and/or Documentation in any form or media;
        (b) Decompile, reverse engineer, or otherwise attempt to derive the 
        source code of the Software;
        (c) Access the Software and Documentation to build a product or service 
        which competes with the Software and/or Documentation;
        (d) Use the Software and/or Documentation to provide services to third 
        parties;
        (e) License, sell, rent, lease, transfer, assign, distribute, display, disclose, 
        or otherwise commercially exploit the Software and/or Documentation; 
        or
        (f) Introduce any viruses, malware, or vulnerabilities into the Licensor's 
        network and information systems.

      2.4 Unauthorized Access
      The Licensee shall use all reasonable endeavors to prevent any unauthorized
      access to, or use of, the Software and/or Documentation and shall promptly 
      notify the Licensor in writing of any such unauthorized access or use.

      2.5Ancillary Licenses
      The Licensee's rights to utilize the Software for Android, iOS, and web 
      platforms are granted solely to the Licensee and shall not extend to any 
      subsidiary or holding company of the Licensee.

    3 Services

      3.1 Service Provision
      Nashid Enterprises LLC ("Licensor") shall provide access to the Nashid Verify 
      SDK ("Software") and make available any related documentation to the 
      Licensee, subject to the terms of this Agreement.

      3.2 Availability
      The Licensor shall use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure the 
      Software is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, except during:
        (a) Planned maintenance, typically carried out between 6:00 PM and 12:00
        AM Oman time.
        (b) Unscheduled maintenance outside of regular business hours, with 
        reasonable efforts made to provide the Licensee with at least 72 hours'
        notice.

      3.3 Support Services
      The Licensor may provide standard support services at no additional cost, in 
      accordance with the Licensor's support policy. The Licensor reserves the right
      to amend this policy as needed. Enhanced support services may be available
      for purchase at current rates.

      3.4 Hardware Requirements
      The Licensee acknowledges that certain hardware may be required for 
      optimal use of the Software. The Licensor will provide recommendations for 
      suitable hardware specifications.
      3.5Software Functionality
      The Software enables the Licensee to perform various identity verification 
      tasks, including but not limited to:
        - Identity document scanning
        - Identity document NFC reading
        - Human liveness verification
        - Human facial matching

    4 Data Protection

      4.1 Privacy Commitment
      Nashid Enterprises LLC ("Licensor") is committed to preserving privacy and 
      data protection in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Law (PDPL) 
      of Oman. All functions of the Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") are designed 
      with these principles in mind.

      4.2 Data Transmission
      No personal data will be transmitted to third-party networks through the 
      Software without obtaining explicit consent from the data owner. This 
      ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and protects the rights of 
      individuals whose data is processed using the Software.

    5 Third Party Providers

      5.1 Third-Party Interactions
      The Licensee acknowledges that the Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") may 
      enable or assist in accessing content, services, and products from third-party
      websites. Any interaction with third-party websites, including the purchase of
      products or services, is done solely at the Licensee's own risk.
      Nashid Enterprises LLC ("Licensor") makes no representation, warranty, or 
      commitment regarding the content, use, or transactions conducted with any 
      third-party websites. Any contracts or transactions entered into are solely 
      between the Licensee and the relevant third party.

      5.2 No Endorsement
      The Licensor does not endorse or approve any third-party websites or the 
      content made available through them. The Licensee is encouraged to review 
      the terms and conditions and privacy policies of any third-party websites 
      before engaging with them.

    6 Licensor's Obligations

      6.1 Performance Standards
      Nashid Enterprises LLC ("Licensor") undertakes that the Nashid Verify SDK 
      ("Software") will perform substantially in accordance with the accompanying 
      documentation, with reasonable skill and care.

      6.2 Limitations of the Undertaking
      The obligation described in clause 5.1 does not apply in cases where non-
      conformance is caused by:
        (a) Use of the Software contrary to the Licensor's instructions.
        (b) Modifications or alterations of the Software by any party other than the
        Licensor or its authorized agents.
      In the event of non-conformance, the Licensor will use reasonable efforts to 
      correct the issue or provide an alternative means of accomplishing the 
      intended functionality. This constitutes the Licensee's sole remedy for any 
      breach of the undertaking in clause 5.1.

      6.3 Disclaimers
      The Licensor does not warrant that:
        (a) The Licensee's use of the Software will be uninterrupted or error-free.
        (b) The Software, documentation, or information obtained through the 
        Software will meet the Licensee’s requirements.
        (c) The Software will be free from vulnerabilities or viruses.

      6.4 Independent Development
      This Agreement does not prevent the Licensor from entering into similar 
      agreements with third parties or from independently developing, using, 
      selling, or licensing documentation, products, and services similar to those 
      provided under this Agreement.

      6.5Legal Compliance
      The Licensor warrants that it has and will maintain all necessary licenses, 
      consents, and permissions required for the performance of its obligations 
      under this Agreement.

    7 Licensee's Obligations

      7.1 General Obligations
      The Licensee shall:
        (a) Provide the Licensor with:
          (i) All necessary cooperation in relation to this Agreement; 
          and
          (ii) All necessary access to information required by the 
          Licensor to provide support or updates for the Software, 
          including but not limited to security access information and
          configuration settings.
        (b) Comply with all applicable laws and regulations regarding its activities 
        under this Agreement.
        (c) Ensure that any authorized users use the Software and Documentation 
        in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, and the Licensee shall
        be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by its authorized 
        users.
        (d) Obtain and maintain all necessary licenses, consents, and permissions 
        necessary for the use of the Software and to enable the Licensor to 
        perform its obligations under this Agreement.
        (e) Ensure that its network and systems comply with the relevant 
        specifications provided by the Licensor.
        (f) Be solely responsible for procuring and maintaining network 
        connections and telecommunications links from its systems to the 
        Software, and for all problems, conditions, delays, delivery failures, and
        all other loss or damage arising from or related to the Licensee's 
        network connections or telecommunications links or caused by the 
        internet.

      7.2 Data Responsibility
      The Licensee shall retain all rights, title, and interest in and to all data it 
      provides for use with the Software ("Licensee Data") that is not personal 
      data. The Licensee is solely responsible for the legality, reliability, integrity, 
      accuracy, and quality of all such Licensee Data.

    8 Charges and Payment

      8.1 Payment Obligation
      The Licensee shall pay fees for the use of the Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") 
      as stipulated in a separate agreement or contract between the Licensor and 
      the Licensee. The specific payment terms, amounts, and schedules are 
      outlined in that agreement.

      8.2 Payment Terms
        (a) All payments shall be made in accordance with the terms agreed 
        upon in the separate contract.
        (b) If payment is not received within the time frame specified in the 
        contract, the Licensor reserves the right to disable the Licensee’s 
        access to the Software until full payment is received.
        (c) Late payments may incur interest or penalties as specified in the 
        separate agreement.

      8.3 Additional Costs
      Any additional costs, such as taxes or transaction fees, shall be the 
      responsibility of the Licensee and will be billed according to the terms of the 
      separate agreement.

      8.4 Fee Adjustments
      The Licensor reserves the right to adjust the fees at the beginning of each 
      renewal period, subject to the terms specified in the separate agreement.

    9 Proprietary Rights

      9.1 Intellectual Property Ownership
      The Licensee acknowledges and agrees that Nashid Enterprises LLC 
      ("Licensor") and/or its licensors own all intellectual property rights in the 
      Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") and associated documentation. This 
      Agreement does not grant the Licensee any rights to, under, or in any 
      patents, copyrights, database rights, trade secrets, trade names, trademarks
      (whether registered or unregistered), or any other rights or licenses in 
      respect of the Software or documentation, except as expressly stated in this 
      Agreement.

      9.2 Licensor's Rights
      The Licensor confirms that it has all the necessary rights in relation to the 
      Software and documentation to grant the rights it purports to grant under 
      this Agreement.

    10 Confidentiality

      10.1 Definition of Confidential Information
      Confidential Information refers to all confidential information (however 
      recorded or preserved) disclosed by one party ("Disclosing Party") to the 
      other party ("Receiving Party") in connection with the Software, including but
      not limited to:
        (a) The terms of this Agreement or any related agreements.
        (b) Any information that would be considered confidential by a 
        reasonable business person relating to the Disclosing Party’s 
        business, assets, affairs, customers, clients, suppliers, plans, 
        intentions, or market opportunities.
        (c) Information relating to the operations, processes, product 
        information, know-how, designs, trade secrets, or software of the
        Disclosing Party.

      10.2 Obligations of Confidentiality
      Each party shall keep the other party's Confidential Information secret and 
      confidential and shall not:
        (a) Use such Confidential Information except for the purpose of 
        exercising or performing its rights and obligations under this 
        Agreement.
        (b) Disclose such Confidential Information in whole or in part to 
        any third party, except as expressly permitted by this section.

      10.3 Permitted Disclosures
      A party may disclose the other party's Confidential Information to its 
      employees, contractors, and advisers who need to know such information for
      the purposes of this Agreement, provided that such representatives comply 
      with the confidentiality obligations set out in this Agreement.

      10.4 Legal Disclosure
      Confidential Information may be disclosed if required by law, governmental 
      or regulatory authority, or by a court or other authority of competent 
      jurisdiction, provided that the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party as 
      much notice of such disclosure as possible.

      10.5 Return or Destruction of Confidential Information
      Upon termination or expiry of this Agreement, each party shall destroy or 
      return all documents and materials containing the other party's Confidential 
      Information and certify in writing that it has complied with these 
      requirements. However, a party may retain documents and materials as 
      required by law or any applicable regulatory authority.

      10.6 Continuation of Obligations
      The obligations of confidentiality shall continue after the termination or 
      expiry of this Agreement.

    11 Indemnity

      11.1 Licensee Indemnity
      The Licensee shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Nashid Enterprises 
      LLC ("Licensor") against any claims, actions, proceedings, losses, damages, 
      expenses, and costs (including without limitation court costs and reasonable 
      legal fees) arising out of or in connection with the Licensee's use of the 
      Nashid Verify SDK ("Software") and/or documentation.

      11.2 Licensor Indemnity
      The Licensor shall defend the Licensee against any claim that the Licensee’s 
      use of the Software in accordance with this Agreement infringes any Omani 
      patent, copyright, trademark, database right, or right of confidentiality, and 
      shall indemnify the Licensee for any amounts awarded in settlement, 
      provided that:
        (a) The Licensor is given prompt written notice of any 
        claim.
        (b) The Licensee provides reasonable cooperation to the 
        Licensor in the defense and settlement of such a claim.
        (c) The Licensor is given sole authority to defend or settle 
        the claim.

      11.3 Remedies
      In the defense or settlement of any claim, the Licensor may:
        (a) Procure the right for the Licensee to continue using the Software.
        (b) Replace or modify the Software so that it becomes non-infringing.
        (c) Terminate this Agreement on 2 Business Days' written notice without 
        additional liability if the above remedies are not reasonably available.

      11.4 Limitations
      The Licensor shall not be liable for infringements arising from:
        (a) Modifications of the Software by the Licensee.
        (b) Use of the Software contrary to Licensor instructions.
        (c) Continued use of the Software after notice of the alleged infringement.

    12. Limitation of Liability
      12.1 No Liability for Results
      Except as expressly provided in this Agreement:
        (a) The Licensee assumes sole responsibility for results obtained from the 
        use of the Software and for conclusions drawn from such use.
        (b) The Licensor excludes all implied warranties, representations, 
        conditions, and terms to the fullest extent permitted by law.
        (c) The Software is provided on an "as is" basis.

      12.2 Exclusions
      Nothing in this Agreement excludes the liability of the Licensor for:
        (a) Death or personal injury caused by the Licensor's negligence.
        (b) Fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

      12.3 Limitations
      Subject to Sections 12.1 and 12.2:
        (a) The Licensor shall not be liable for any loss of profits, business, data, or
        information, or for any indirect, special, or consequential loss.
        (b) The Licensor's total liability arising in connection with this Agreement 
        shall be limited to OMR 2,000.

    13. Term and Termination

      13.1 Term
      This Agreement commences on the Effective Date and continues for an 
      Initial Term of 24 months. It automatically renews for successive periods 
      unless terminated with 30 days' notice before the end of the current term.

      13.2 Termination for Cause
      Either party may terminate this Agreement with immediate effect if the 
      other party:
        (a) Fails to pay any amount due and remains in default for 45 days after 
        notice.
        (b) Commits a material breach of this Agreement and fails to remedy it 
        within 30 days.
        (c) Repeatedly breaches the Agreement.
        (d) Becomes insolvent or enters into administration, among other similar 
        events.

      13.3 Effects of Termination
      On termination:
        (a) All licenses granted under this Agreement shall immediately terminate.
        (b) Each party shall return or destroy all Confidential Information of the 
        other party.
        (c) The Licensor may destroy or return any Licensee data in its possession 
        unless requested otherwise within 10 days of termination.

      13.4 Termination for Convenience
      Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience with 60 days’ 
      notice, with penalties applicable for early termination.

    14.  Force Majeure

    Neither party shall be liable for delays or failures in performance due to 
    events beyond its reasonable control. If such delay continues for three 
    months, the unaffected party may terminate this Agreement with 60 days'
    notice.

    15.  Conflict

    If there is any inconsistency between the provisions in the main body of 
    this Agreement and any Schedules, the provisions in the main body shall 
    prevail.

    16. Variation

    No variation or amendment of this Agreement shall be effective unless in 
    writing and signed by both parties.

    17.  Waiver

    A waiver of any right or remedy under this Agreement is only effective if 
    given in writing and does not constitute a waiver of any subsequent right 
    or remedy.

    18.  Rights and Remedies

    Except as expressly provided in this Agreement, the rights and remedies 
    provided are in addition to any rights or remedies provided by law.

    19.  Severance

    If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid, illegal, or 
    unenforceable, it shall be deemed deleted, and the validity of the 
    remaining provisions shall not be affected.

    20.  Entire Agreement

    This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and
    supersedes all prior agreements and understandings.

    21.  Assignment

    The Licensee shall not assign or transfer its rights or obligations under 
    this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Licensor.

    22.  No Partnership or Agency

    Nothing in this Agreement creates a partnership or agency relationship 
    between the parties.

    23.  Third-Party Rights

    A person who is not a party to this Agreement shall have no rights to 
    enforce any of its provisions.

    24.  Counterparts

    This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be 
    deemed an original.

    25.  Notices

    Notices required under this Agreement shall be in writing and delivered 
    personally, by registered post, commercial courier, or email.

    26.  Governing Law and Jurisdiction

    This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the Sultanate of Oman, 
    and the courts of Oman shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any 
    disputes.
